intro: Gomphandra tetrandra, commonly known as the four-thread gomphandra, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy surface. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, a feature known as monoecious.
